title: Memento (2000)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller "Memento" offers a complex moral narrative as it explores themes of memory, identity, and deception, making it a near-perfect match for the user's preferences. The film's intricate plot and moral ambiguity will keep the user engaged throughout.

title: Shutter Island (2010)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller plot of "Shutter Island" aligns well with the user's preference for moral complexity as it involves a labyrinthine investigation with ethical dilemmas, questionable motives, and a shocking twist that challenges the protagonist's perception of reality.

title: The Prestige (2006)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect is present with the themes of obsession, revenge, and murder. The moral complexity comes from the ambiguous motivations and identities of the characters, particularly the twins, and the consequences of their actions.

title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (2004)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect may not be strongly present, but the film explores complex moral themes such as love, memory, and the consequences of altering one's past. The intertwining storylines and character motivations add to the intrigue and moral complexity.

title: Fight Club (1999)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect is present with the formation of Fight Club and Project Mayhem, and the moral complexity comes from the exploration of dissociative identity disorder and the anti-consumerist and anti-corporate themes.

title: Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels (1998)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller "Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels" aligns well with the user's preference for moral complexity as it explores themes of debt, betrayal, and the consequences of criminal actions. The intricate plot involves multiple interconnected storylines and characters, each with their own motivations and moral dilemmas.

title: The Usual Suspects (1995)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller "The Usual Suspects" offers moral complexity through its intricate plot involving deceit, betrayal, and a mysterious criminal mastermind, Keyser Söze, whose true identity is revealed in a shocking twist. The film's exploration of the lengths people will go to for power, revenge, and survival aligns well with the user's preference for a morally complex crime thriller.

title: Requiem for a Dream (2000)
explanation: "Requiem for a Dream" delivers a gritty crime thriller with moral complexity as it explores the destructive consequences of drug addiction and the lengths people will go to achieve their dreams, ultimately revealing the harsh realities and consequences of their choices.

title: Seven (a.k.a. Se7en) (1995)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller "Seven" delivers on moral complexity with its intricate exploration of the seven deadly sins and the psychological motivations of the serial killer, making it a near-perfect match for the user's preferences.

title: American History X (1998)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect is present with the portrayal of racism and violence, and the moral complexity comes from the character development of Derek, who undergoes a transformation in prison and tries to turn away from his neo-Nazi beliefs.

title: No Country for Old Men (2007)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller "No Country for Old Men" delivers moral complexity through its intricate plot involving a ruthless hitman and a desperate man trying to keep his ill-gotten fortune. The film explores themes of fate, morality, and the relentless nature of violence.

title: Reservoir Dogs (1992)
explanation: "Reservoir Dogs" is a gritty crime thriller with complex moral dilemmas as it explores the consequences of betrayal and loyalty among criminals.

title: V for Vendetta (2006)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect is present with the portrayal of a dystopian society ruled by a neo-fascist regime and the use of violence and torture. The moral complexity comes from the exploration of themes such as resistance, sacrifice, and the blurred lines between good and evil, as well as the revelation of the true motivations and identities of various characters.

title: Nightcrawler (2014)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller "Nightcrawler" delivers moral complexity through its protagonist's questionable actions and the ethical dilemmas faced by the news industry.

title: The Dark Knight (2008)
explanation: The Dark Knight delivers a gritty crime thriller with complex moral dilemmas, as the Joker challenges the morality of Batman and other characters, leading to tragic consequences.

title: Inglourious Basterds (2009)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect is present with the violent attacks on Nazi soldiers and the moral complexity comes from the intricate plot involving multiple characters and their motivations, including Shosanna's desire for revenge and Landa's negotiation for immunity.

title: Ex Machina (2015)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect comes from the deception and manipulation between the characters, as well as the dark revelations about Nathan's past actions. The moral complexity arises from the blurred lines between human and artificial intelligence, and the question of what it means to be conscious and have emotions. The plot also explores themes of trust, manipulation, and survival.

title: Whiplash (2014)
explanation: The gritty crime-like elements come from the abusive and morally complex relationship between Andrew and Fletcher, as well as the intense pressure and competition within the jazz program. The moral complexity lies in the question of whether Fletcher's methods, though abusive, ultimately lead to Andrew's success and personal growth.

title: Django Unchained (2012)
explanation: "Django Unchained" aligns well with the user's preference for a gritty crime thriller with moral complexity, as it explores themes of slavery, redemption, and revenge in a violent and intricate manner. The film's complex characters and morally ambiguous situations add to its appeal for someone in the mood for a thought-provoking and intense crime thriller.

title: Moon (2009)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect may not be immediately apparent, but the moral complexity arises from the ethical dilemmas presented by the use of clones and the deception of the protagonist. The plot explores themes of identity, morality, and corporate greed, making it a thought-provoking and complex watch for those in the mood for a crime thriller.

title: In Bruges (2008)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect is present with the hitman plot and the moral complexity comes from the characters' actions and their consequences, particularly Ray's struggle with guilt and redemption. The film also explores themes of morality, forgiveness, and the human capacity for change.

title: Trainspotting (1996)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller "Trainspotting" explores the moral complexities of heroin addiction and its destructive consequences on relationships and personal lives, aligning well with the user's preference.

title: Prisoners (2013)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller explores moral complexity through the actions of the main character, Keller Dover, who takes the law into his own hands and tortures a suspected kidnapper, raising questions about the morality of his actions and the lengths one will go to protect their family.

title: American Beauty (1999)
explanation: "American Beauty" offers a gritty exploration of moral complexity through its intricate portrayal of infidelity, homophobia, and the disillusionment of the American Dream. The crime elements add tension and suspense, making it a compelling crime thriller.

title: Sin City (2005)
explanation: "Sin City's gritty crime thriller explores complex themes of morality, corruption, and revenge, aligning well with the user's preference."

title: Goodfellas (1990)
explanation: "Goodfellas" delivers a gritty crime thriller with intricate moral complexities as it explores the allure and consequences of a criminal lifestyle, featuring characters with questionable morals and a nonlinear narrative that highlights the cyclical nature of their actions and the inevitable retribution.

title: Inception (2010)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect is present with the team performing corporate espionage and dealing with the consequences of their actions. The moral complexity comes from the characters' motivations and the ethical dilemmas they face, such as Cobb's guilt over his wife's death and the team's manipulation of people's subconscious. The intricate plot and the exploration of the subconscious add depth to the story.

title: The Big Lebowski (1998)
explanation: The Big Lebowski offers a gritty crime thriller with complex moral themes, as the main character becomes entangled in a web of lies and deception, and the line between good and evil becomes blurred. The plot also features elements of dark humor and unexpected twists, which should appeal to the user's preference for moral complexity.

title: District 9 (2009)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller aspect is present with the government's mistreatment of the alien population and the brutal experimentation on Wikus. The moral complexity comes from the exploration of themes such as racism, discrimination, and the consequences of power and corruption.

title: The Silence of the Lambs (1991)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller "The Silence of the Lambs" aligns well with the user's preference for moral complexity as it explores the intricacies of criminal behavior and the ethical dilemmas faced by the protagonist in dealing with a cannibalistic serial killer.

title: Little Miss Sunshine (2006)
explanation: While "Little Miss Sunshine" does involve elements of crime (smuggling a dead body) and moral complexity (family dynamics and personal setbacks), the tone is more quirky and comedic than gritty. The crime aspect is not the main focus of the story.

title: There Will Be Blood (2007)
explanation: This gritty crime thriller explores moral complexity through the ruthless actions and questionable morals of the main character, Daniel Plainview, as he navigates the oil industry and deals with various obstacles and adversaries. The plot involves elements of deception, betrayal, and violence, all of which align well with the user's preference for a complex crime thriller.

title: Zodiac (2007)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller "Zodiac" offers moral complexity through its exploration of the obsessive investigation into the Zodiac killer, the pressure on law enforcement to solve the case, and the impact on the personal lives of those involved. The plot delves into the psychological aspects of the killer's taunting letters and the lengths investigators go to in their pursuit of justice.

title: Catch Me If You Can (2002)
explanation: While "Catch Me If You Can" does involve elements of crime and moral complexity, the tone is more light-hearted and entertaining than gritty. title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2011)
explanation: The gritty crime thriller "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo" offers moral complexity through its intricate plot involving sexual abuse, power dynamics, and the investigation of a series of murders. The film explores the dark side of human nature and the lengths people will go to seek justice and protect themselves. The presence of a brilliant and troubled investigator, Lisbeth Salander, adds depth to the story and offers a compelling counterpoint to the main character, Mikael Blomkvist. The film's themes of abuse, power, and justice align well with the user's preference for a gritty crime thriller with moral complexity.

title: Blood Diamond (2006)
explanation: This gritty crime thriller explores the complex moral issues surrounding the diamond trade in a war-torn African country, with themes of family, redemption, and the consequences of greed. title: Her (2013)
explanation: While "Her" does touch on themes of moral complexity and crime (e.g., infidelity), the overall tone and focus of the movie is more on the relationship between a man and an operating system, which may not fully align with the user's preference for a gritty crime thriller.
